solution_line_template: Given that the tank is {initial_fill_fraction} full of water, and that it requires {gallons_to_fill} gallons to fill. {full_tank_fraction} full tank -{initial_fill_fraction} tank = {empty_fraction} of the tank is empty, which is equal to {gallons_to_fill} gallons.

If {empty_fraction_value_text} of the tank equals {gallons_representing_empty_portion} gallons, this means {one_third_fraction_value_text} of the tank is equal to {gallons_representing_empty_portion} / {divisor_for_one_third} gallons = <<{gallons_representing_empty_portion}/{divisor_for_one_third}={gallons_representing_one_third}>>{gallons_representing_one_third} gallons

The total capacity of the tank or how much the tanks holds = {gallons_to_fill} + {gallons_representing_one_third} = <<{gallons_to_fill}+{gallons_representing_one_third}={total_capacity}>>{total_capacity} gallons
